Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AIL_DLS_get_reverb

The function AIL_DLS_get_reverb retrieves the simple reverb settings of the DLS software synthesizer.

void AIL_DLS_get_reverb(
  HDLSDEVICE dls,
  F32 *reverb_level,
  F32 *reflection_time,
  F32 *reverb_decay_time
);

In Parameters

dls
indicates the DLS device whose reverb settings are to be retrieved.

Out Parameters

reverb_level
returns the amount of reverb that is being applied from 0.0F (no reverb) to 1.0F (maximum reverb).
reflection_time
returns the time in seconds between the reflections.
reverb_decay_time
returns the approximate time in seconds for the reflection to die out.

Discussion

You must open the digital driver that the software synthesizer is using with reverb for the reverb functions to have any effect (see the DIG_REVERB_BUFFER_SIZE preference).

Reverb requires CPU time to apply - how much depends on the reflection time (shorter is slower) and decay time (longer is slower). Short reflection periods with long decay time are the worst CPU eaters. You can monitor the CPU use with the AIL_digital_CPU_percent function.


Group: DLS Services
Related Functions: AIL_DLS_set_reverb, AIL_digital_CPU_percent
